name: I/O Extended 2017 Jinja
description: Google I/O Extended 17 brings local developers in and around Jinja together to experience the I/O keynote and sessions in real-time. Participants will also engage in unique activities including codelabs, and product demos.

name: GDD Europe 2017 Extended - Jinja
description:
Come join us as we showcase the latest developer products and platforms from Google which will help you to quickly develop high quality apps as well as grow and retain an active user base for your product or service.

Enthusiastic developers in and around Jinja will watch keynotes streamed live from Europe and learn about the latest updates to android, the mobile web, Firebase, Cloud, IoT, and design.

name: DevFest 2017 Eastern Uganda
description:
GDG DevFest 2017 is the biggest Google technology conference in Eastern Uganda, and is organized and run by three Google Developer Groups: GDG Jinja, GDG Mbale and GDG Busitema. Expect to interact with experienced Mobile and web app developers, offering you firsthand experience in codelabs, hackathons and speaker sessions across multiple product areas including Firebase, cloud, IoT and more.

Please check our website for updates on speakers, sessions and agenda.

name: GDays Uganda
description: End of year community conference for entrepreneurs and developers organized by Google Business Group (GBG) Jinja and supported by Google.
how_to_find_us: IGAR PLAZA HOTEL above Igar Cafe - Jinja.

name: Cloud Study Jam - Jinja
description:
Come join us as we learn how :

+ to set up development and production environments in the Cloud
+ Docker and Kubernetes work
+ to process Big Data in the Cloud.

Attendees will get access to Qwiklabs.com, a Google training tool ($70+ value), free of charge.

What more? Get Google-hosted badges like this (https://google.qwiklabs.com/public_profiles/3707ebde-dc9a-47e6-8992-84a84a85b929) for you online profile and show potential employers what you know about Cloud computing.

name: Mobile Sites Certification Study Jam - Jinja
description:
• What we'll do
Mobile is changing the world and now accounts for more than 50% of all web traffic, and users expect their small-screen experiences to be as quick and intuitive as those on desktop. But making the mobile web fast and easy takes special skills.

The Mobile Sites Certification study jam offers a great opportunity for you to master the skills to design and develop a mobile-friendly site.

Even more, earn yourself a printable certificate to verify status as a certified mobile sites professional and a Google Partners public profile page listing the certification when you complete the exam.

• What to bring

• Important to know

name: Grow your Business Workshop
description:
• What we'll do
If you do not already have one, you will get a Website for your business and learn and how to keep it up-to-date using Google Sites, for Free. There will be an Exhibition for products and services by businesses in the community so grab this chance to showcase what your business has to offer.

• What to bring

• Important to know

name: IWD Jinja 2018
description:
• What we'll do
International Women's Day (IWD) 2018 is a women's tech conference that will bring together designers, developers and technology entrepreneurs. This event will highlight stories of women in those categories under the theme: Building a New Horizon.

Agenda:
09:00 AM Arrivals and Registration
Keynote
Code Lab: Using Firebase to create Android applications
Workshop: Building a Mobile Site
Lunch
Product Demos
Recognition and Awards
Closing Remarks
04:00 PM Networking and Departure • What to bring

• Important to know

name: Machine Learning Study Jam
description:
• What we'll do
You probably have heard about Machine Learning (ML) and all the amazing things it can do. Well, here is your chance to learn about ML during the Machine Learning Study Jam where we will run through the Machine Learning Crash Course (MLCC).

This course is intended for those who wish to learn about ML from a practical applied perspective that will enable you to use machine learning in your everyday projects and learn about the power of TensorFlow. This a great opportunity for anyone with basic technical knowledge and limited Machine Learning knowledge willing to gain some practical experience in ML and TensorFlow.

Come along with your laptop!

• What to bring
A Laptop.

• Important to know

name: I/O Extended 2018
description:
• What we'll do
Google I/O Extended 2018 is here! Developers and IT enthusiasts in and around Jinja will gather to watch the I/O 18 keynote and sessions in real-time. In addition, we'll have great speakers at the event and participants will get put their hands to work on exciting codelabs and get a chance to demo their products.

• What to bring

• Important to know

name: Build Actions for Your Community
description:
• What we'll do
Build Actions for Your Community is an opportunity for you to learn how to build great apps for the Google assistant that are useful for your users - whether it's a professional network, interest group or location. It will be fun building something in an area that you care about or are interested in.

We'll have a series of Build Actions for Your Community events this year with the second in April (https://www.meetup.com/GDG-Jinja/events/248090195/) and the last in June (https://www.meetup.com/GDG-Jinja/events/248090225/).

• What to bring

• Important to know

name: The Digital Garage
description:
Do you have a business? Are you considering starting one? Are you a career person, and would like to improve your prospects in succeeding at an Interview?

Join us at this Free event as we explore tools and skills to improve your search engine visibility, as well as improve your Interview Skills.

• What to bring
Laptop (if you have one), CVs (if you are a career person)

name: Next '18 Extended Jinja
description:
Are you a developer, IT decision maker, tech product manager or an entrepreneur? Join us at Cloud Next '18 Extended Jinja as we experience first hand what's new in Google Cloud Platform, G Suite, Maps, and Devices.

Participants will also engage in unique activities including hands-on practice working with cloud technologies and software.

Even more exciting is the opportunity to earn Google Cloud badges and access to Qwiklabs - a learning environment that helps you get hands-on experience with leading cloud platforms and software.

We'll stream the keynote, have talk sessions as well as code labs.

name: Flutter Study Jam
description:
• What we'll do
Ever wanted to build high-quality apps for iOS and Android devices?
Come join us at the Flutter Study Jam and learn how to use Flutter to quickly develop high-quality, interactive mobile applications for iOS and Android devices.

Whether you’re just getting started with mobile app development, or experienced with other mobile app frameworks, you’ll enjoy the high-velocity development and quality apps that Flutter enables. You will get hands-on experience with Flutter and build a Flutter app while learning the fundamentals.

Flutter is Google’s mobile app SDK for crafting high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android in record time. Flutter works with existing code, is used by developers and organizations around the world, and is free and open source.

• What to bring
A Laptop.
Notebook and Pen!

• Important to know
The course will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, the laptop should have Flutter installed on it prior to starting the study jam to save time. Windows/Linux/Mac would all be fine. Check out: https://flutter.io/get-started/install/
how_to_find_us: Opposite Spot 6 on Jinja Main street.

name: Flutter Study Jam
description:
Ever wanted to build high-quality apps for iOS and Android devices?
Come join us at the Flutter Study Jam and learn how to use Flutter to quickly develop high-quality, interactive mobile applications for iOS and Android devices.

Whether you’re just getting started with mobile app development, or experienced with other mobile app frameworks, you’ll enjoy the high-velocity development and quality apps that Flutter enables. You will get hands-on experience with Flutter and build a Flutter app while learning the fundamentals.

Flutter is Google’s mobile app SDK for crafting high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android in record time. Flutter works with existing code, is used by developers and organizations around the world, and is free and open source.
how_to_find_us: Opposite Spot 6 on Jinja Main street.

name: DevFest 2018 Jinja
description:
GDG DevFest 2018 is our annual all-day developer conference that offers speaker sessions across multiple product areas, codelabs, hackathon and more!

AGENDA:
9:00 AM Registration & Welcome Coffee
10:00 AM Introduction to Flutter
10:50 AM What's new in Google Assistant
11:40 AM Getting started with the Firebase Real-time Database
12:30 PM Lunch time
2:00 PM Firebase web applications
2:50 PM Panel Session: Google Assistant, Flutter, Firebase.
3:40 PM Codelab
4:30 PM Coffee Break
5:00 PM Closing & Networking

name: Google Assistant Labs
description: Design, build, and distribute fully-customizable conversational Actions that get things done across Google.
how_to_find_us: Opposite Spot 6 on Jinja Main street.

name: Cloud Study Jam
description:
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin? Join us for our Cloud Study Jam!
Get official Google training, a $55+ value, free of charge. Together we'll work through several Google Cloud labs. You will get hands-on experience with the Cloud Console, Security, IoT on Cloud, and Machine Learning.
Then after our live session, you will have free access to more labs you can finish at home. Complete all labs in the quest and earn a Google-hosted badge for your online profile, and additional 30 days access to the training platform to compete any labs you want

== What to Bring ==
Bring a laptop and charger (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed. Don’t forget your charger!
how_to_find_us: Opposite Spot 6 on Jinja Main street.

name: TenslorFlow Dev Summit 2019 Viewing Party
description:
• What we'll do
TensorFlow Dev Summit 2019 is here! Developers and IT enthusiasts in and around Jinja will gather to watch the keynote and machine learning sessions in real-time, and get to listen to tech talks and conversations with the TensorFlow team and community.

• What to bring

• Important to know

name: IWD Jinja
description: International Women's Day is approaching and again we're super excited to be celebrating the contributions of women in technology. Come join designers, coders, product managers and entrepreneurs as we share, learn and support more women to get into the tech space.

name: Next '19 Extended Jinja
description:
Join us at Next '19 Extended Jinja as we experience first hand what's new in

Google Cloud Platform, G Suite, Maps, and Devices.
Participants will also engage with peers through hands-on labs on cloud technologies and speaker sessions.
